intro: Myrrhis tenerrima, commonly known as the bitter panicgrass, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its tufted growth habit and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in coastal and inland grasslands. Myrrhis tenerrima is adapted to arid conditions and is considered a resilient species in its native habitat.
